title: Win 10 Install error
body:
- [ ] I've asked for help in the [Truffle Gitter](http://gitter.im/Consensys/truffle) before filing this issue.

---------------------------

## Issue

What the issue is, in broad strokes.
https://gist.github.com/rfikki/5554651b135341ac044293556ddba92c
## Steps to Reproduce
Install latest version
Please provide the shortest amount of steps to reproduce your issue.

## Expected Behavior
clean error free install
What you expected to happen.

## Actual Results
https://gist.github.com/rfikki/5554651b135341ac044293556ddba92c
What actually happened. Please give examples and support it with screenshots, copied output or error messages.

## Environment

* Operating System:  Win 10
* Truffle version: 3.2.4
* Ethereum client: geth
* node version: node v7.4.0
* npm version: npm  v4.2.0
+1 I'm having the same issue

For one, it looks like the dependency, fs-ext, is currently failing on Windows builds: https://ci.appveyor.com/project/baudehlo/node-fs-ext/branch/master. It seems that it is currently impossible to use Truffle on Windows as long as this dependency is failing.
Additionally, anything using execSync will not succeed because it does not seem to be supported on Windows anymore: https://github.com/mgutz/execSync#readme. 
Both these issues propagate errors during installation.

Seems to be relatively easy to resolve then.

1. fs-ext seems to be used mostly for ```copySync``` and ```readFileSync```. I opened [an issue](https://github.com/baudehlo/node-fs-ext/issues/69) on fs-ext repo, not sure how easy it is to resolve, but at least as a workaround I believe (correct me if wrong) that fs-ext functionality can be manually implemented instead of adding it as a dependency.

2. execSync module seems to be unneeded, as
> both iojs and node.js v0.12 have execSync function

I agree with the solutions you propose - the dependencies could be replaced with the alternatives you suggest. The problem, unfortunately, seems that they are not dependencies of Truffle itself, but dependencies of dependencies. I will put together a list of Truffle dependencies that use these problematic libraries. However, short of replacing these dependencies, I don't have a good action plan to propose at the moment.

Here's the result of a quick analysis on Truffle dependencies: 

**Dependent on fs-ext**
lock-me (dependencies and optionalDependencies)

**Dependent on execSync**
codecov@1.0.1

**Dependent on codecov@1.0.1**
request
ignore
shelljs
node-fetch
regenerate
babylon
aegir
interface-datastore

The funny thing is that the codecov main branch is at 2.2.0. The execSync library was removed from its dependencies a while ago. Unfortunately, a lot of libraries within the dependency tree still use 1.0.1.

We might be able to get away with the execSync failure - I'm not sure if that one is a fatal during installation. Can anyone speak to that? 

As for IPFS's lock-me, I'll look into opening an issue about that.

So, how about we fork codecov & lock-me and make the fixes there? (And push upstream as well)
That should do it, no?

I think that _should_ do it, so I'm looking into that now (but I don't know if that covers all the errors in the installation log).

I forked lock-me to see what would be involved in replacing fs-ext with a Windows compatible option. However, I'm noticing a discrepancy.  In the lock-me library, package.json defines fs-ext as **only** an optional dependency. However, when we install Truffle and navigate to truffle/node_modules/lock-me/package.json, fs-ext is listed under **both** dependencies and optional dependencies. I can actually install lock-me locally without problem because installation skips the optional dependency fs-ext! When installing Truffle, however, lock-me installation seems to think fs-ext is mandatory.

Perhaps this is a result of some npm behaviour that I'm not aware of. Do you have any ideas why it might want to install the optional dependencies? We still might be able to get around this problem by replacing fs-ext entirely, so I'll continue looking at that option.

Installs perfectly ðŸ˜Ž 

Added a PR to include the workaround in the readme. #419

Version 3.2.1 appears to still work, so that's good news. 
As you suggest, @ProphetDaniel, a git compare could reveal what the issue is.

> Installs perfectly :sunglasses:

That is great @ripper234.

Latest version installation that still worked in my windows 10 was 3.2.2. The problem started to happen on truffle 3.2.3. So this is something related to windows 10 and with truffle starting with version 3.2.3.

That means @bvrooman , git comparing truffle 3.2.3 with 3.2.2 should reveal the problematic change.

Linux OS
Both latest truffle 3.2.4 and the previous 3.2.3 installations work in my KDE neon linux OS.

I'll try comparing those versions and see what I find. Unfortunately, I have a lot on my plate at the moment and I might not be able to get around to it just yet. That said, if anyone else wants to have a go at it, I won't stop you ;)
I confirm that version 3.2.2 works for me as well.
Yes, I mentioned in the truffle Gitter channel awhile back that 3.2.2 works the problem started with version 3.2.3 truffle.

Okae. Well, I got it done after installing windows-build-updates in my Win
10.
I suppose there's no fix for Ubuntu 16.10 yet?

On 4 Jun 2017 6:00 p.m., "Rocky Fikki" <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> Yes, I mentioned in the truffle Gitter channel awhile back that 3.2.2
> works the problem started with version 3.2.3 truffle.
>
> â€”
> You are receiving this because you are subscribed to this thread.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/trufflesuite/truffle/issues/411#issuecomment-306037199>,
> or mute the thread
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/Abp4z4zVumsPvX7qghN4toTvNRUfGnu4ks5sAqNVgaJpZM4NjIrD>
> .
>

Hi all. A new beta has been pushed out that should fix this issue. Details in the blog post [here](http://truffleframework.com/blog/how-were-making-installation-issues-a-thing-of-the-past). Can you give it a shot and report back?
@tcoulter Great, I'll give that a shot tonight and tell you all how it goes. I like the direction you are taking the dependency management, based on what I read in your post.
It installed like a breeze in my windows 10 setup with `npm install truffle@beta`. I tested main functionalities like init, compile, migrate and test and it looks alright.

Installing the beta version appears to work well. I was able to installing with `npm uninstall truffle` followed by `npm install truffle@beta`.
I have a couple comments:
- The beta version appears to introduce some breaking changes. For example, the following no longer works: `var Compiler = require('truffle/lib/contracts')`. Has this been replaced by truffle-compiler? Will this be the same for things like `require('truffle/lib/commands/migrate')`?
- I forked Truffle and tried `npm install`. On Windows 10, this still fails with the same log as posted in this issue.

Installed using `npm install -g truffle@beta` on 32-bit Win 10. Tried out truffle init, compile, migrate and test. Works fine.

But then I tried `truffle init webpack` on another dir, and it shows the following error:

> Error: Cannot find module "."
>     at webpackMissingModule (C:\Users\user\AppData\Roaming\npm\node_modules\truf                                                                                                                fle\build\cli.bundled.js:209703:61)
>     at C:\Users\user\AppData\Roaming\npm\node_modules\truffle\build\cli.bundled.                                                                                                                js:209703:139
>     at <anonymous>

But some initialization has been made as the folder now contains:

> app/  contracts/  migrations/  package.json  README.md  test/  truffle.js  webpack.config.js

Subsequently, running compile or migrate says:

> Error: Cannot find module 'babel-register'
>     at Function.Module._resolveFilename (module.js:485:15)
>     at Function.Module._load (module.js:437:25)
>     at Module.require (module.js:513:17)
>     at require (internal/module.js:11:18)
>     at Object.<anonymous> (C:\Users\user\uffle\truffle.js:2:1)
>     at Module._compile (module.js:569:30)
>     at Object.Module._extensions..js (module.js:580:10)
>     at Module.load (module.js:503:32)
>     at tryModuleLoad (module.js:466:12)
>     at Function.Module._load (module.js:458:3)

npm install -g truffle failed on windows 10
got error when wrtc is being installed. Seems msbuild related. scratched my head for hours after midnight, until I stumbled upon this post

npm install -g truffle@3.2.1 and npm install -g truffle@3.2.2 both are successful.

Thanks.

$ truffle init webpack
Downloading project...
Installing dependencies...
Error: Cannot find module "."
    at webpackMissingModule (C:\Users\Rocky\AppData\Roaming\npm\node_modules\truffle\build\cli.bundled.js:209703:61)
    at C:\Users\Rocky\AppData\Roaming\npm\node_modules\truffle\build\cli.bundled.js:209703:139
